questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: He's drinking some water.
He's checking his reflection in the mirror.
He's enjoying a meal at the table.
He's reading a paper in a dining area.
questions.script:
（A）He's drinking some water.
（B）He's checking his reflection in the mirror.
（C）He's enjoying a meal at the table.
（D）He's reading a paper in a dining area.
（A）他正在喝水。
（B）他正在查看自己在镜中的影像。
（C）他正在餐桌旁吃饭。
（D）他正在就餐区读报纸。
·He is looking over the paper.
他正在查看报纸。
·He is studying the newspaper.
650

他正在研究报纸。
·He is leafing through the paper.
他正在浏览报纸。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: The woman is picking out an item.
The woman is cleaning the floor.
The woman is helping a customer.
The woman is trying on a jacket.
questions.script:
（A）The woman is picking out an item.
（B）The woman is cleaning the floor.
（C）The woman is helping a customer.
（D）The woman is trying on a jacket.
（A）女士正在挑选商品。
（B）女士正在扫地。
（C）女士正在为顾客服务。
（D）女士正在试穿夹克。
·The woman is choosing an item.
女士正在挑选商品。
·The woman is about to select an item on the rack.
女士正打算从货架上挑选一件商品。
·She has reached out to pick out an item from the rack.
她已经伸出手去从货架上拿商品。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: The aircraft is about to land at the airport.
The people are boarding the plane.
The cargo is being loaded onto the plane.
The plane landed a short while ago.
questions.script:
（A）The aircraft is about to land at the airport.
（B）The people are boarding the plane.
（C）The cargo is being loaded onto the plane.
（D）The plane landed a short while ago.
（A）这架飞机正要在机场着陆。
（B）人们正在登机。
（C）货物正在被装上飞机。
（D）飞机刚着陆一小会儿。
·The woman is stepping down from the plane.
女士正在走下飞机。
·An exit ramp extends up to the door of the plane.
出舱舷梯伸到了飞机门口。
·The passengers are walking away from the plane.
乘客们正在离开飞机。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: One man is standing at the door. 651
The men are walking up the stairs.
One man is filming the other.
The men are being interviewed.
questions.script:
（A）One man is standing at the door.
651

（B）The men are walking up the stairs.
（C）One man is filming the other.
（D）The men are being interviewed.
（A）一位男士正站在门口。
（B）男士正在上楼梯。
（C）一位男士正在给另一位男士拍照。
（D）男士正在接受采访。
·One man has crouched down.
一位男士已经蹲下了。
·One man is holding a camera on his shoulder.
一位男士肩上正扛着摄像机。
·The man being filmed is wearing a safety helmet.
正被拍摄的男士戴着安全头盔。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: The tables have been set up indoors.
A waiter is serving the customers.
Some people are seated outside.
The area is entirely shaded.
questions.script:
（A）The tables have been set up indoors.
（B）A waiter is serving the customers.
（C）Some people are seated outside.
（D）The area is entirely shaded.
（A）餐桌已经在室内摆好了。
（B）一位服务员正在为顾客服务。
（C）一些人在室外就座了。
（D）整块区域都是阴凉地。
·There are tables and chairs set up outdoors.
室外摆放着餐桌和椅子。
·There are buildings on both sides of the street.
街道两边都有建筑。
·There are still seats available.
还有座位空着。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: The cars are parked on the road.
There are vehicles in the driveway.
The windows are being cleaned.
A man is getting into the car.
questions.script:
（A）The cars are parked on the road.
（B）There are vehicles in the driveway.
（C）The windows are being cleaned.
（D）A man is getting into the car.
（A）汽车停在路上。
652

（B）车道上有车辆。
（C）有人正在擦窗户。
（D）一位男士正在上车。
·There are trees growing around the house.
房子周围种着树。
·The vehicles are parked next to each other.
这些车辆并排停放着。
·The cars are parked facing the same direction.
这些汽车都朝一个方向停放。
注：在Part 1中，每道试题都添加了3种可能的正确表达方式，考生可
以了解对于同样的照片可能出现的不同表达。

questions.question: When are you thinking of taking off?
options: As soon as I get this done.
He took it with him.
At around 3 last night. 你想什么时候动身呢？
questions.script:
When are you thinking of taking off?
（A）As soon as I get this done.
（B）He took it with him.
（C）At around 3 last night.
你想什么时候动身呢？
（A）我一把这个做完（就动身）。
（B）他把它带在身上。
（C）昨天夜里3点左右。
Q When are you going?
A When I get this work done.
你什么时候走呢？
—当我把这项工作做完的时候。

questions.question: Where in Canada are you from?
options: I was born in Kingston.
Early tomorrow morning.
No, I don't feel like it. 你是加拿大哪个地方的人呢？
questions.script:
Where in Canada are you from?
（A）I was born in Kingston.
（B）Early tomorrow morning.
（C）No, I don't feel like it.
你是加拿大哪个地方的人呢？
（A）我出生在金士顿。
（B）明天一大早。
（C）不，我不喜欢它。
Q What part of Canada do you come from?
653

A I grew up in Kingston.
你是加拿大哪个地方的人？
—我在金士顿长大。

questions.question: Pardon me, but would it be possible for me to use your phone?
options: Sure, but you have to dial 9 to call out.
The phone directory is on the lower shelf.
There is one on the first floor of this building. 不好意思，我可以用你的电话吗？
questions.script:
Pardon me, but would it be possible for me to use your phone?
（A）Sure, but you have to dial 9 to call out.
（B）The phone directory is on the lower shelf.
（C）There is one on the first floor of this building.
不好意思，我可以用你的电话吗？
（A）可以，不过你打电话前要先拨9。
（B）电话姓名簿在下面的架子上。
（C）这栋楼的一层有一个。
Q Excuse me, but may I use your phone?
A Be my guest.
打扰一下，我可以用你的电话吗？
—请不要客气。

questions.question: How much is it to get into the place?
options: There is a ten-dollar cover charge.
Sure, we can go there if you'd like.
How about going this Saturday? 进那里要多少钱？
questions.script:
How much is it to get into the place?
（A）There is a ten-dollar cover charge.
（B）Sure, we can go there if you'd like.
（C）How about going this Saturday?
进那里要多少钱？
（A）需要10美元的服务费。
（B）好的，如果你乐意的话，我们可以去那里。
（C）这周六去怎么样？
Q How much is the entrance fee?
A It's ten dollars.
入场费是多少？
—10美元。

questions.question: Why don't we flag down a cab?
options: Let's just go for a walk instead.
It's about an hour from here.
Because it's a national holiday. 我们为什么不乘出租车？
questions.script:
Why don't we flag down a cab?
（A）Let's just go for a walk instead.
（B）It's about an hour from here.
（C）Because it's a national holiday.
我们为什么不乘出租车？
654

（A）我们还是散散步吧。
（B）从这里过去要一个小时左右。
（C）因为是全国性的假日。
Q Why don't we grab a cab?
A I'd rather walk.
我们为什么不打车呢？
—我更想走路。
注：在Part 2中，为帮助考生提高听懂题目的能力，添加了和试题相同
或相似的表达方法。

questions.question: Are you going to take the bus to Chicago?
options: The boss told me to.
To pick up someone.
No, I am going to drive. 你打算乘坐巴士去芝加哥吗？
questions.script:
Are you going to take the bus to Chicago?
（A）The boss told me to.
（B）To pick up someone.
（C）No, I am going to drive.
你打算乘坐巴士去芝加哥吗？
（A）老板让我去做。
（B）去接某人。
（C）不，我打算开车去。
Q How are you planning to get to Chicago?
A I'll be taking my car.
你打算怎么去芝加哥？
—我打算自己开车去。

questions.question: Who is supposed to show up at the party?
options: Everyone said they'll be there.
He's holding it at a banquet hall.
Yes, I had a great time there. 谁应该在派对上露面呢？
questions.script:
Who is supposed to show up at the party?
（A）Everyone said they'll be there.
（B）He's holding it at a banquet hall.
（C）Yes, I had a great time there.
谁应该在派对上露面呢？
（A）每个人都说要来。
（B）他正在宴会厅举行派对。
（C）是的，我在那里度过了愉快的时光。
Q Who's planning to come to the party?
A As far as I know, everyone will be there.
谁打算来参加这次派对？
655

—据我所知，每个人都会过去。

questions.question: How long are you thinking of going?
options: For about a year or so.
What's with the long face?
Yes, I will be going with John. 你想离开多久？
questions.script:
How long are you thinking of going?
（A）For about a year or so.
（B）What's with the long face?
（C）Yes, I will be going with John.
你想离开多久？
（A）大约一年。
（B）为什么愁容满面？
（C）是的，我将和约翰一起去。
Q How long are you planning to be away?
A I'm thinking of spending a year abroad.
你计划离开多久？
—我在考虑在国外待一年。

questions.question: Would you like to go for lunch together?
options: At the company cafeteria.
There are four people in our group.
Thank you, but I am too busy today. 你想一起去吃午饭吗？
questions.script:
Would you like to go for lunch together?
（A）At the company cafeteria.
（B）There are four people in our group.
（C）Thank you, but I am too busy today.
你想一起去吃午饭吗？
（A）在公司食堂。
（B）我们组有四个人。
（C）谢谢，不过我今天太忙了。
Q Why don't we have lunch together?
A Can we do it another time instead?
我们一起吃午饭怎么样？
—我们可以改天吗？

questions.question: Where do you feel like meeting, here in my office or somewhere outside?
options: Okay, that sounds like a good place to meet.
How about the little coffee shop on Main Street?
Yes, I think I can spare the time to see you. 你想在什么地方见面，是我办公室这里，还是外面什么地方？
questions.script:
Where do you feel like meeting, here in my office or somewhere outside?
（A）Okay, that sounds like a good place to meet.
（B）How about the little coffee shop on Main Street?
（C）Yes, I think I can spare the time to see you.
你想在什么地方见面，是我办公室这里，还是外面什么地方？
（A）可以，那听起来是个不错的见面地点。
（B）主街的小咖啡店怎么样？
656

（C）是的，我想我可以抽时间见见你。
Q Would you like to meet in my office or at a coffee shop somewhere?
A The coffee shop on Main Street sounds good.
你想在我的办公室碰面呢，还是在什么地方的咖啡店呢？
—主街的咖啡店听起来不错。

questions.question: When will you start your new position at the head office?
options: The first of next month.
At the downtown office.
I'm heading this one. 你什么时候开始到总公司的新岗位上班呢？
questions.script:
When will you start your new position at the head office?
（A）The first of next month.
（B）At the downtown office.
（C）I'm heading this one.
你什么时候开始到总公司的新岗位上班呢？
（A）下个月的1号。
（B）在位于市中心的办公室。
（C）我正负责这个。
Q When is your first day at the main office?
A I'll start going there from next month.
你什么时候开始在总公司上班？
—我下个月开始去那里上班。

questions.question: Didn't you think Peter gave a great presentation?
options: Yes, he was very impressive.
Yes, for three hours.
I already got the present. 你难道不认为彼得的演讲很棒吗？
questions.script:
Didn't you think Peter gave a great presentation?
（A）Yes, he was very impressive.
（B）Yes, for three hours.
（C）I already got the present.
你难道不认为彼得的演讲很棒吗？
（A）是的，他给人留下了很深刻的印象。
（B）是的，三个小时。
（C）我已经收到礼物了。
Q Wasn't Peter's presentation impressive?
A Yes, it was quite inspiring.
彼得的演讲难道不令人难忘吗？
—是的，确实很鼓舞人心。

questions.question: Should we try Greek food tonight?
options: Yes, he is from Greece.
Sure, I'd love to try it. 657
I didn't go there tonight. 今晚我们尝尝希腊菜怎么样？
questions.script:
Should we try Greek food tonight?
（A）Yes, he is from Greece.
（B）Sure, I'd love to try it.
657

（C）I didn't go there tonight.
今晚我们尝尝希腊菜怎么样？
（A）是的，他是从希腊来的。
（B）好的，我乐意去试试。
（C）我今晚没有去那里。
Q How about having Greek food this evening?
A That sounds very delicious.
今晚吃希腊餐如何？
—听起来很好吃。

questions.question: What did Mr. Smith say about the new project?
options: He made some great comments.
The projector is in the meeting room.
Yes, he mentioned it to me. 史密斯先生对于新项目说了些什么?
questions.script:
What did Mr. Smith say about the new project?
（A）He made some great comments.
（B）The projector is in the meeting room.
（C）Yes, he mentioned it to me.
史密斯先生对于新项目说了些什么?
（A）他给予了很高的评价。
（B）投影仪在会议室。
（C）是的，他向我提起过。
Q How did Mr. Smith respond to the project?
A He seemed very positive about it.
史密斯先生是如何回应这个项目的？
—他似乎对它很有信心。

questions.question: Would you rather stay here or go for a walk with me?
options: I've been waiting for an hour.
Let me get my jacket.
Yes, I think so. 你是想待在这里，还是想和我出去散散步呢？
questions.script:
Would you rather stay here or go for a walk with me?
（A）I've been waiting for an hour.
（B）Let me get my jacket.
（C）Yes, I think so.
你是想待在这里，还是想和我出去散散步呢？
（A）我已经等了一个小时了。
（B）让我去拿夹克。
（C）是的，我认为是这样。
Q How would you like to go for a stroll?
A Sure, let me put on my jacket first.
你觉得出去遛个弯怎么样？
658

—好的，让我先穿上夹克。

questions.question: Who put the event together?
options: Larry's the one in charge.
I will put it there later.
Sorry, I can't go today. 谁组织了这次活动？
questions.script:
Who put the event together?
（A）Larry's the one in charge.
（B）I will put it there later.
（C）Sorry, I can't go today.
谁组织了这次活动？
（A）拉里是负责人。
（B）我一会儿会把它放到那里。
（C）抱歉，我今天不能去。
Q Who's responsible for putting together the event?
A Larry is heading this one.
谁负责组织这次活动？
—拉里负责本次活动。

questions.question: Should I take my car, or do you think it would be wiser to take the bus?
options: The boss is a wise man.
Let's just hop in a cab instead.
It shouldn't take over an hour. 我应该自己开车吗，或者你觉得乘公交车是不是更明智一点？
questions.script:
Should I take my car, or do you think it would be wiser to take the bus?
（A）The boss is a wise man.
（B）Let's just hop in a cab instead.
（C）It shouldn't take over an hour.
我应该自己开车吗，或者你觉得乘公交车是不是更明智一点？
（A）老板是个精明人。
（B）我们还是打车吧。
（C）不会超过一小时的。
Q Do you think it'd be better to drive or take the bus?
A It's probably faster to take a cab.
你觉得是开车还是坐公交车更好呢？
—可能打车会快一点。

questions.question: Didn't you bring your car to work this morning?
options: No, I took the bus today.
Yes, I will drive you there.
She might be working today. 你今天早晨不是开车来上班的吗？
questions.script:
Didn't you bring your car to work this morning?
（A）No, I took the bus today.
（B）Yes, I will drive you there.
（C）She might be working today.
你今天早晨不是开车来上班的吗？
（A）不，我今天是坐公交车来的。
（B）是的，我会开车把你送到那里。
659

（C）她今天也许在工作。
Q Did you not drive to work today?
A No, I left my car at home.
你今天没有开车来上班吗？
—没有，我把车放在家里了。

questions.question: Can I tell John that you are here?
options: Sure, that would be okay.
Yes, he is here today.
No, we are not leaving yet. 我可以告诉约翰你在这里吗？
questions.script:
Can I tell John that you are here?
（A）Sure, that would be okay.
（B）Yes, he is here today.
（C）No, we are not leaving yet.
我可以告诉约翰你在这里吗？
（A）好的，没问题。
（B）是的，他今天在这里。
（C）不，我们现在还不走。
Q Should I let John know that you came by?
A Yes, could you?
我可以告诉约翰你过来了吗？
—好的，有劳了。

questions.question: Today is a great day to go for a walk by the beach.
options: Yes, it is a beautiful day.
I didn't know it was raining.
I went swimming the other day. 今天是去海边散步的好日子。
questions.script:
Today is a great day to go for a walk by the beach.
（A）Yes, it is a beautiful day.
（B）I didn't know it was raining.
（C）I went swimming the other day.
今天是去海边散步的好日子。
（A）是的，今天天气很好。
（B）我不知道在下雨。
（C）我前几天去游泳了。
Q This is great weather to just wander around the beach.
A Yes, I agree with you.
今天天气不错，适合去海边散步。
—是的，我同意你的说法。

questions.question: Where do you get your car fixed?
options: I park my car in the underground garage.
From a grocery store near my house. 660
Why? Are you having car problems? 你的车是在哪里修的？
questions.script:
Where do you get your car fixed?
（A）I park my car in the underground garage.
（B）From a grocery store near my house.
660

（C）Why? Are you having car problems?
你的车是在哪里修的？
（A）我把我的车停在地下车库了。
（B）从我家附近的一家杂货店。
（C）怎么了？你的车出毛病了吗？
Q Where do you take your car to get it repaired?
A What's wrong with it?
你在哪里修的车？
—它出了什么毛病？

questions.question: Are you making the presentation today, or is Mr. Smith going to do it?
options: He is going to be here any minute now.
He told me to take care of it today.
It is supposed to last until three. 今天是你还是史密斯先生要作报告呢？
questions.script:
Are you making the presentation today, or is Mr. Smith going to do it?
（A）He is going to be here any minute now.
（B）He told me to take care of it today.
（C）It is supposed to last until three.
今天是你还是史密斯先生要作报告呢？
（A）他现在随时都可能到这里。
（B）他让我今天负责这次报告。
（C）它应该会持续到3点。
Q Are you going to make the speech today, or will Mr. Smith do it?
A He's away on a business trip.
今天是你还是史密斯先生要作报告呢？
—他出差了。

questions.question: What is it about the design that you don't like?
options: Yes, I need your signature.
That's very kind of you.
The color seems to be a bit off. 您不喜欢这个设计的什么地方？
questions.script:
What is it about the design that you don't like?
（A）Yes, I need your signature.
（B）That's very kind of you.
（C）The color seems to be a bit off.
您不喜欢这个设计的什么地方？
（A）是的，我需要您的签名。
（B）您真是太好了。
（C）好像有点掉色。
Q What part of the design do you not like?
A The color is not right.
这个设计的哪个部分您不喜欢？
661

—颜色不合适。

questions.question: Does Peter know that Mr. Kim knows why he was late to the meeting?
options: He's been informed.
I was five minutes late.
He was stuck in traffic. 彼得知道金先生了解他开会迟到的原因吗？
questions.script:
Does Peter know that Mr. Kim knows why he was late to the meeting?
（A）He's been informed.
（B）I was five minutes late.
（C）He was stuck in traffic.
彼得知道金先生了解他开会迟到的原因吗？
（A）他已经被告知了。
（B）我迟到了五分钟。
（C）他被堵在路上了。
Q Is Peter aware of the fact that Mr. Kim knows why he was late to the
meeting?
A Yes, I told him.
彼得知道金先生了解他开会迟到的原因吗？
—知道，我告诉他了。

questions.question: Did you talk to Cindy this morning or last night?
options: I'm thinking of taking off today.
She left a message on my machine.
It may not last that long. 你是今天上午还是昨天晚上和辛迪谈的？
questions.script:
Did you talk to Cindy this morning or last night?
（A）I'm thinking of taking off today.
（B）She left a message on my machine.
（C）It may not last that long.
你是今天上午还是昨天晚上和辛迪谈的？
（A）我想今天请假。
（B）她在我的电话答录机上留言了。

Welcome to Yellow Submarine Apartments. We are going to give you a guided
tour of this new seaside apartment complex, which incorporates many radical new
architectural and lifestyle innovations. Whether you are interested in buying a
retirement or holiday home, a main residence, or even an investment property,
we at the Yellow Submarine Consortium can offer you some stunning

basement car park, friendly security staff members ensure your complete
security twenty-four hours a day. （72）As you can see from the foyer, only the
finest quality materials have been used in combination with the superb design.

Questions 74 through 76 refer to the following announcement.
The CTV annual speech contest is a prestige competition with a tradition
going back twenty-five years. （74）The winner of the first competition, held
in 1981, was Brian McAdams, （75）now a well-known television journalist and
anchorman for CTV. We'd like to remind you that the highest standards will be
expected of all contestants at all times. However, we'd also like to say that the
benefits of participating are enormous even if you don't win. A pre-competition
round of selections will be held here next Monday—that's June the sixth—
beginning at 8:00 p.m. So, please fill in your entry form, and we'll see you back
here next Monday. （76）Thanks!
CTV年度演讲比赛是一个享有盛誉的比赛，有着25年的传统。布赖恩·
麦克亚当斯是1981年第一届比赛的冠军，他现在是CTV著名的电视记者和新
闻节目主播。我们想提醒大家，所有的参赛者在任何时候都要表现出最高的
689

水准。不过，我们也还是想说，即使你在比赛中不能获胜，参加这项比赛的
收获还是很多的。赛前选拔环节将于下星期一——也就是6月6日在这里举
行，选拔从晚上8点开始。所以请填写报名表，下星期一在这里见。谢谢！

Questions 77 through 79 refer to the following telephone message.
Hi, Mark. I've been trying to contact you by e-mail, but for some reason
you have not responded. （77）This is Julie, the secretary of the Choral Society.
I hope you receive this message in time. We've had to cancel tonight's rehearsal
at the last minute. （78）If for some reason you don't get this message tonight, I
apologize—there won't be anybody else at the hall this evening. I hope you
understand that our conductor is unable to attend because of some urgent family
business, （79）and we've decided to postpone the rehearsal until next week. I
can't really give you any more details at the moment, but I'll let you know in the next
few days. See you soon.
你好，马克。我一直试着通过电子邮件联系你，但是由于某种原因你还
没有回复。我是合唱协会的秘书朱莉。我希望你能及时收到这条留言。在最
后一刻我们不得不取消今天晚上的排练。如果出于某种原因今晚你没收到这
条信息，我向你道歉——今天晚上大厅里不会有其他人的。我希望你能理
解，我们的指挥因为一些紧急的家事无法来了。我们已经决定把排练推迟到
下星期。现在我真的不能提供更多的详情，但是过几天我会让你知道的。再
见。

Questions 80 through 82 refer to the following speech.
Tonight truly marks a milestone in the history of this association. When it was
created 100 years ago with the intention of encouraging the conservation of
English culture, （80）who would have thought that it would not only survive but
also prosper until the present day? From one club with 36 members meeting in one
venue in England, we have grown into a nationwide association of 50 clubs with
over 600 members. （81）And the annual prize for a special contribution to
English culture, which has been made possible by the generosity of our local
businessmen, has become one of the nation's most prestigious awards. （82）
今晚的确是本协会历史上里程碑式的时刻。当100年前为鼓励保护英国
文化创建本协会时，谁会想到这个协会不仅能存活到今天，而且还一直在蓬
勃发展？它从最初拥有36名会员、在英格兰某处聚会的俱乐部，发展成为拥
有超过600名会员、50个俱乐部的全国性协会。由我们本地商人慷慨资助的
年度英国文化特别贡献奖已经成为国家最有声望的奖项之一。

Questions 83 through 85 refer to the following talk.

Welcome to the Goldfields Tour! We have about a one-hour bus trip
through beautiful rolling hills before we reach the first stop on our tour, （83）
the picturesque and historic town of Daylesford. When we reach Daylesford, I
suggest that we simply stroll around the old town for around thirty minutes to an
hour. Daylesford was founded at the time of the first gold rush and is largely
unchanged（84）since the boom period of the 1880s. Why don't you stop at one
of the famous bakeries on the main street for some delicious coffee and cakes?
（85）Return to the bus by 11:00 a.m., and we will proceed with the rest of the
tour. Thank you.
欢迎参加金地之旅！旅途的第一站是风景如画、历史悠久的戴尔斯福德
城，在此之前，我们要坐约一个小时的巴士，沿途可以欣赏连绵起伏的美丽
丘陵。到了戴尔斯福德，我建议大家围绕这座老城逛30分钟到1小时左右。
戴尔斯福德建造于第一次淘金热的时候，从19世纪80年代的繁荣时期以来大
体上就没有什么变化。你们为什么不顺便去主街上一家有名的面包店品尝美
味的咖啡和蛋糕呢？上午11点之前请回到巴士，我们将继续下面的旅程。谢
谢。

Questions 86 through 88 refer to the following talk.
Excuse me, ladies and gentlemen. I hope you enjoyed your meal. Personally, I
found it to be an absolute feast, and I'd like to thank the organizers for their
marvelous work. It's time to move on to the more formal part of the evening,
which comprises the awards for journalist and photojournalist of the year.
（86）This year has been a particularly dark and dangerous one for
journalists working in war zones. （87）I can only say how much I admire and
respect those courageous writers and photographers who have risked death and
even torture in order to bring the truth to the world. Would everyone please give a
big round of applause for our chief editor? He is going to present our first
award. （88）
女士们，先生们，打扰一下。我希望这顿饭菜能合你们的胃口。就我个
人而言，我觉得这绝对是一次盛宴，我要谢谢筹办方了不起的工作。现在该
进行今晚较为正式的环节了，包括为年度记者和摄影记者颁奖。今年对于在
696

战区工作的记者们来说是极其黑暗和危险的一年。我只能说我有多么钦佩和
尊重那些勇敢的记者和摄影师们，他们为了把真相告诉世人，冒着死亡甚至
酷刑的危险。大家可以用热烈的掌声欢迎我们的主编吗？他将给颁发我们的
第一个奖项。

marvelous 了不起的 formal 正式的 comprise 包含，包括 journalist 记者
photojournalist 摄影记者 particularly 格外地 courageous 勇敢的 torture 酷刑，
折磨

Questions 89 through 91 refer to the following telephone message.
Hello, this is Michael Kruger from Kruger's Family Delicatessen. We've just
received a delivery from your company, （89）but on inspection we have
found that an entire pallet of tinned anchovies has been damaged. （90）It
looks like they fell at some time during transportation. Some of the tins have broken
and are leaking oil. Many others are dented. We can't possibly accept them at the
agreed price. We've already spent two hours cleaning up dripping oil. Either we
can return them to you and you can deduct the costs from your next invoice, or we'll
accept them at a substantial discount. Why don't you send a sales representative?
（91）We need to sort this out as soon as possible. Thanks.
您好，我是克鲁格家庭熟食店的迈克尔·克鲁格。我们刚刚收到从贵公
司发来的一批货。但是在检查时我们发现一整托盘的凤尾鱼罐头都已经坏掉
了。看起来它们在运输的时候掉下来过。一些罐头盒已经摔坏了，正在漏
油。许多其他的罐头盒凹了下去。我们不能按原来商定的价格接受它们。我
们已经花了两个小时清洗滴下来的油。要么我们把货物寄回给你们，你们可
以在下一次的发票上扣除这次的成本，要么给我们多打些折扣以便我们接
受。你们为什么不派一个销售代表过来呢？我们需要尽快解决这件事情。谢
谢。

Questions 92 through 94 refer to the following talk.
Our Sales Department has a particularly proud record since the founding of
the company in 1946. （92）Starting out just after the Second World War, our
company employed three traveling salesmen and a national sales manager to expand
our operations aggressively throughout North America. Of course, we couldn't have
done that without top quality products to sell. On the other hand, without sales
and a hungry sales staff, the company would not have been able to survive, let
alone expand as it has done in the last sixty years. （93）You have been
chosen from a field of sixty applicants to continue that tradition, （94）and we
have faith that through your energy and positive attitude we will be able to continue
our expansion to markets all over the world.
从公司1946年成立以来, 我们销售部取得了特别值得骄傲的成绩。我们
公司在二战结束不久创建的时候, 雇用了三名旅行推销员和一名全国销售经
理，将我们的经营范围扩张到整个北美洲。当然，没有最优质的产品出售，
我们也不会取得这样的成绩。但从另外一方面来说，如果没有销售部和积极
的销售人员，公司根本就不可能生存下来，更不用说在过去60年间所做的扩
张了。我们从60名应聘者中挑了你们去延续这一传统。我们相信通过你们的
努力和积极的态度我们一定能将市场扩大到全世界。

hand 另一方面 survive 生存 applicant 应聘者 tradition传统，惯例 faith 信心，
信念 positive 积极的 attitude 态度 credit 功劳 founder缔造者，创造人 veteran
